extension.title: .NET MAUI
extension.description: Extend C# Dev Kit with tools for building .NET Multi-platform App UI (MAUI) apps
maui.launch.projectPath.description: The path to the project to launch.
maui.launch.project.description: The path to the project to launch.
maui.task.useVSDbg.description: Use the .NET Core Debugger backend (vsdbg) to debug MAUI Apps (supported for .NET 8.0.202 or higher)
maui.launch.config.name: .NET MAUI
maui.launch.config.label: .NET MAUI
maui.task.targetFramework.description: The specific target framework to build for, default is all.
maui.configuration.debugServerPort.descr: The port to use for the debug server.
maui.configuration.androidSdkPreferredPa: The preferred Android SDK directory to build and debug Android applications
The preferred Java SDK directory to build and debug Android applications
maui.configuration.experimental.useVSDbg: Use the .NET Core Debugger backend (vsdbg) to debug MAUI Apps (supported for .NET 8.0.202 or higher)
maui.walkthrough.title: Get Started with .NET MAUI
maui.walkthrough.description: Get set up to build cross-platform mobile and desktop apps with .NET Multi-platform App UI (MAUI).
maui.walkthrough.signInStep.title: Connect account to C# Dev Kit
maui.walkthrough.signInStep.description:
You can sign in with your Microsoft account. If you have a Visual Studio subscription, you can get information about your subscription after you've signed in.
[Connect](command:csdevkit.signIntoVsAccount)
maui.walkthrough.setUpDotNetSdkStep.desc:
The .NET SDK is required to build with .NET in VS Code.
[Install .NET SDK](https://aka.ms/dotnet-extensionpack-sdk)
maui.walkthrough.setUpMauiSdkStep.title: Set up your .NET MAUI environment
maui.walkthrough.setUpMauiSdkStep.descri:
The .NET MAUI SDK is required to build a .NET MAUI App in VS Code.
[Open a Terminal](command:workbench.action.terminal.new)
maui.walkthrough.createNewMauiAppStep.de:
Create your .NET MAUI App by choosing the .NET MAUI project template from the command palette to scaffold your project.
[Create .NET MAUI App](command:vscode-maui.searchNewProjectFromCommandPalette)
maui.walkthrough.setUpAdditionalConfigur:
Set up additional target platforms to deploy your .NET MAUI App to all possible platforms!
[Configure Additional Targets](https://aka.ms/vscode/maui/howToConfigure)
maui.walkthrough.buildLaunchAndDebugStep:
Run and debug your application using the debugger. [Learn more about debugging in VS Code...](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/debugging)
[Launch your .NET MAUI App](command:workbench.action.debug.start)
maui.walkthrough.learnMoreStep.title: Learn more
maui.walkthrough.learnMoreStep.descripti:
Explore all the features the .NET MAUI Tools for C# Dev Kit Extension has to offer by looking for “.NET MAUI:” in the Command Palette.
[Open Command Palette](command:vscode-maui.searchFromCommandPalette)
maui.configuration.logVerbosity.descript: The verbosity of logging in the Output Panel for '.NET MAUI'. The order of levels from least verbose to most verbose is: 'minimal' < 'detailed' < 'diagnostic' (default: 'detailed').
maui.configuration.logVerbosity.diagnost: Show diagnostic information. Useful when diagnosing unexpected behaviors.
maui.configuration.debugVerbosity.descri: The build task's verbosity when debugging. The order of levels from least verbose to most verbose is: 'minimal' < 'detailed' < 'diagnostic' (default: 'minimal').
maui.configuration.debugVerbosity.diagno: Show diagnostic information and generate a binlog. Useful when diagnosing unexpected behaviors.
